meanings.definition: Contributing to a cause or result
meanings.sent1: Her contributory efforts helped the team win the game.
meanings.sent2: The contributory factors to the success of the project were teamwork and dedication.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's contributory role in gathering nuts was crucial for the winter ahead.
meanings.sent4: The sun's warmth was a contributory force in melting the snow away.
meanings.sent5: The teacher praised Tommy for his contributory behavior in class.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that contributes to something
meanings.sent1: She was a valuable contributory to the charity event.
meanings.sent2: The volunteers were essential contributories to the community cleanup.
meanings.sent3: The little bird became a contributory by bringing twigs for the nest.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the jester played the role of a contributory to the king's decisions.
meanings.sent5: The new machine proved to be a reliable contributory to increasing productivity.

meanings.sent1: The contributory event welcomed all community members to participate.
meanings.sent2: The contributory meeting required input from all team members.
meanings.sent3: The contributory picnic was a fun way for everyone to join in.
meanings.sent4: The contributory project allowed students to actively engage in learning.
meanings.sent5: The contributory spirit of the group made the event a success.
